reviews.review_msg: Grace was a great prof, very good lecture slides and exams were fair. Paper was also very easy. Not too many readings, although textbook chapters are long. Overall I enjoyed this class.
She clearly puts a lot of work into her slides and the materials are all useful. Exams cover the material taught.

Wow interesting class but so much work. We read approximately 20-25 journal articles and 8 textbook chapters which were between 30-60 pages long for the most part. Exams were not super difficult but got some getting used to. Curve was very high were 88 was an A- even though it was a seminar! all in all if it was tweaked would take again but meh

it was a seminar class that ran like a lecture.  Half way through class all I want to do is bang my head on the table. Class was just reviewing the data from the article we had to read.Student discussion was non-existent.  However, I cant hate him because he is smart and helpful,just dont make me sit through another class!
One of the very best professors I have ever had. Extremely helpful, and you learn a lot. I'm going to miss him!

AMAZING prof! Probably the best I've ever had. He is very open to other views and encourages critiques of his work. I asked him a question about a particular topic and he came back the next class with a whole article on it photocopied for me! Very caring, very clear, and amazing overall:)
Great class, great prof, interesting material...but what was with all the photos of his wang?  It was kind of cool the first couple of times, but after that it just got weird.

I have no idea why people are complaining...I took this course after reading those terrible comments and was expecting a tough and horrible prof/course...but it's not like that at all. the notes are clear, he tells you what's going to be on the midterm and final, materials can be dry sometimes but overall interesting. I'd take his course again.
He talks way too fast. The material isn't all that interesting either. He doesn't seem interested in what he is teaching.
